verses.roman:
tatra cakruḥ parivṛḍhau
gopā rāma-janārdanau
kṛṣṇa-saṅghaṭṭinaḥ kecid
āsan rāmasya cāpare

synonyms: tatra—in that game; cakruḥ—they made; parivṛḍhau—the two leaders; gopāḥ—the cowherd boys; rāma-janārdanau—Lord Balarāma and Kṛṣṇa; kṛṣṇa-saṅghaṭṭinaḥ—members of Kṛṣṇa's party; kecit—some of them; āsan—became; rāmasya—of Balarāma; ca—and; apare—others.
translation: The cowherd boys chose Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma as the leaders of the two parties. Some of the boys were on Kṛṣṇa's side, and others joined Balarāma.
